name: Phosphatidylserine (PS)
description: Phospholipid that is a major component of cell membranes, particularly concentrated in brain tissue. Supports cognitive function, cortisol regulation, and cell signaling. FDA-qualified health claim for cognitive decline risk reduction. Levels decline with age.

dosage.notes: Soy or sunflower derived. FDA-qualified health claim for dementia risk reduction (2003). Take with meals (fat-soluble). May help cortisol management for athletes.

keyFindings: Improved cognitive function in elderly with memory complaints (multiple RCTs)
FDA-qualified health claim for reduced dementia risk
Blunted cortisol response to exercise stress in athletes
